translation.title: The Interior and the End of Relishing

next.name: The Exterior and the End of Relishing

segments.en: 156. The Interior and the End of Relishing

segments.pli: “Aniccaṃyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhuṃ aniccanti passati, sāssa hoti sammādiṭṭhi.
segments.en: “Mendicants, the eye really is impermanent. A mendicant sees that it is impermanent: that’s their right view.
When relishing ends, greed ends. When greed ends, relishing ends.
When relishing and greed end, the mind is said to be well freed.

segments.pli: aniccaṃyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhu jivhaṃ aniccanti passati, sāssa hoti sammādiṭṭhi.
aniccaṃyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhu manaṃ aniccanti passati, sāssa hoti sammādiṭṭhi.
segments.en: mind really is impermanent. A mendicant sees that it is impermanent: that’s their right view.
When relishing ends, greed ends. When greed ends, relishing ends.
When relishing and greed end, the mind is said to be well freed.”
